page.title: 03LIFESTYLES VILLAGE MORELEIGH
page.content: The buildings in Moreleigh are of mixed styles and construction - there are six council houses but no listed or protected buildings. The Church is All Saints and is reputed to be 13th Century. Moreleigh boasts a Post Office, two post boxes and a telephone kiosk. The Post Office sells sweets, tobacco and stationery. Although there is no public transport to or from Moreleigh it is possible to use the school bus service. Harbertonford has a community bus scheme running which it is hoped will be developed to include several villages, Moreleigh and Halwell among them. Moreleigh is visited by a local baker twice a week, a baker/grocer and a fishmonger once a week, a butcher who will bring orders and milk and eggs are delivered from Halwell. The mobile library calls every fortnight.
